bookText.htmlContent: Mysterious fox-like creatures from another world. Members of this race have large tufts of fur near their ears distinct from regular fennecs.

[style.boldRED(Delphox)]

Fox mages with power over fire and the mind. By focusing on the flame of a lit branch, it can see into the future. Like most creatures with power over the arcane, it frequently combats visions of lust due to Lilith's influence.

Its dominion over fire is incredibly potent. It can enrapture its foes in a vortex of flame hot enough to boil iron.

Delphox can be found in the same places as most foxes and youkos. They seem to have enough self-control to not stray into seedier places as the likes of Submission.

Unlike normal foxes, or most other mammals for that matter, Delphox deliver their offspring by laying eggs. Once they hatch, Lilith's magics quickly hasten their growth into Delphox themselves.

Using an Everstone on a Delphox will cause them to regress into Braixen.


[style.boldORANGE(Braixen)]

A scorching hot fox with a branch in its tail. The friction from removing it sets it alight, allowing it to be used as a signal for allies and a conduit for its fire spells.

Despite its effeminate, witch-like appearance, only about 1 in 8 Braixen are actually female, though many in Lilith's Realm don't seem to care.

Braixen also lay eggs to rear their young. Their Fennekin form can briefly be seen before Lilith's magic forces them to grow.

Feeding a Rare Candy to a Braixen will cause them to evolve into Delphox.

Using an Everstone on a Braixen will cause them to regress into Fennekin.


[style.boldGINGER(Fennekin)]

These small foxes can often be seen chewing on twigs. They're not just full of hot air, one could literally fry an egg on the air their ears give off.

Oddly enough, the feral form of these creatures are quadrupedal, like most foxes, instead of upright like its two evolved forms. As a result, it's the only species of which true "taurs" are possible.

Not much else is known about this species or its line as a whole, almost as if the documents describing these creatures should have written entries in more than one pair of games.

Although Fennekin may appear young at a glance, they are perfectly intelligent, cognizant, and sexually able from the moment they hatch. Thusly, a Fennekin's offspring doesn't seem affected by Lilith's growth magic whatsoever.

Feeding a Rare Candy to a Fennekin will cause them to evolve into Braixen.
